intro: Trochetia pentaglossa, commonly known as the five-lobed bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Kazakhstan and Tajikistan. The plant is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Trochetia pentaglossa is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, arid environments.
